description:
You create a tiny wisp out of fog, no larger than the palm of your hand, and send it to any location within 1 mile. When casting this spell you may give the wisp a trigger to watch for. If the trigger occurs within the wisp's 30 foot area, you will receive a mental notification and the wisp will disappear.

You may only have one wisp at a time. If you recast this spell before the duration expires, the original wisp will disappear.
name: Aether Wisp

description:
You summon a necrotic hand to grab at your target. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. If it hits, the target takes 1d12 necrotic damage and has their movement speed reduced to 0. This damage is repeated at the start of the creature's turn as long as the spell is still in effect.

The affected creature may make a Fortitude save against your character DC on their turn to break free from the hand, restoring their movement speed.
name: Clutching Hand

description: You attempt to understand the motivations of a creature. The target creature makes a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you have +2 to Insight checks against the creature for 1 hour.
name: Sense Intent

description:
You briefly illuminate yourself with soft, warm light. All allies within 10 feet of you heal for 1d6 hit points. If you, or any of the creatures, are subject to the poisoned, dazed, frightened, or terrified conditions, those conditions are removed.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the area of the spell's light. The light's radius increases by 5 feet for each additional arcanum spent.
name: Calming Light

description:
You summon a small ember in your hand. While in your hand, it gives off a dim light in a 10 foot radius. As an action on following turns, you can use it to start small fires on inanimate objects.

As a bonus action on following turns, or for free on the turn you summon it, you may throw the ember at a creature within range. Make a spell attack against their AC. On a hit, the creature takes 1d10 fire damage.
name: Ember

description: You create a powerful clap of thunder that can knock a creature prone. Choose a creature within range to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 1d4 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone.
name: Thunderstrike

description: You attempt to stabilize a dying creature by cauterizing their wounds. Target a dying creature within range. They take one failed death saving throw and are then considered stabilized.
name: Cauterize Wounds

description:
You exhale a gust of icy wind in a straight line. All creatures within a 20 foot line of you must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are pushed back 5 feet and take 2d6 cold damage. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not pushed back.

If a creature cannot be pushed back 5 feet, due to an obstacle or another creature, they instead take an additional 1d6 bludgeoning damage.
name: Frost Breath

description:
You use magic to blend into your surroundings. For the next hour, the target of this spell has +10 to Stealth checks.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of creatures affected. You may target one additional creature for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Refractory Skin

description: You attempt to illuminate a creature, marking them. Choose a creature you can see within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are outlined in radiant light and the next attack that hits them during the spell's duration deals an additional 1d8 radiant damage.
name: Illuminate

description: Choose a creature within range that is dying. They take one additional failed death save.
name: Usher Unto Death

description: You converse with the natural world around you and gain information on your surroundings. You may learn what the weather will be for the next 24 hours, convince a flower to bloom, or discover what creatures are close by.
name: Hear Nature

description:
You attempt to outline creatures with sparkling dust. Choose a 10-foot cube within range. All creatures within the affected area must make Reflex saves against your character DC. On a failure, they become coated in sparkling dust, lowering their AC by 2 for the duration of the spell. This spell reveals invisible enemies.

Creatures can spend an action to wipe the dust off, returning their AC to normal.
name: Sparkling Dust

description:
You reach out and touch a creature, attempting to sap their life force. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, you deal 1d12 necrotic damage to them.

If the creature is not undead or a construct, you gain temporary health equal to the damage dealt.
name: Lesser Draining Touch

description:
You can control up to 5 cubic feet of water. While under your control, the water can be shaped as you see fit. You may also use this spell to freeze water into ice or thaw ice into water.

This spell has no effect on other liquids or holy water.
name: Control Water

description:
Choose up to 4 creatures within range. While this spell is active, the chosen creatures may roll an additional 1d4 on all attack rolls and saving throws.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of creatures affected. You may target one additional creature for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Bless

description:
You create a magical lock on a chest, container, or door. The lock appears as a floating rune on top of the object being guarded.

When you cast this spell, you may decide a code word or phrase, no longer than 5 words, that will temporarily disable the lock and grant access.

You may also, as part of casting this spell, configure it to notify you when a creature attempts to open it, regardless of if they failed or succeeded. This notification can be a verbal sound or a mental ping. For the mental ping to register, you must be within 1 mile of the lock.
name: Magical Lock

description: You touch a willing creature, causing thick bark to cover their skin. Until the end of the spell, the target's AC cannot be less than 16.
name: Barksin

description:
You attempt to hypnotize a creature. Choose a creature within range to make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they become dazed. A dazed creature has a -5 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

The dazed creature can reattempt the save at the end of each of its following turn. On a successful save, they are no longer dazed.

Once a creature succeeds against this spell, they are immune to its effects for 24 hours.
name: Hypnotize

description:
You disguise yourself, making your body and any items of clothing on it look different for the duration of the spell. The spell does not modify your body type but can make you appear up to 1 foot shorter or taller than your actual height. The illusion created by the spell is permeable and regular objects will pass through without resistance.

Creatures can attempt to see through the illusion by making a Will save against your character DC.
name: Disguise Self

description: You cover yourself in a thin layer of basalt dust. Your base AC increases to 14 but you no longer get your Dexterity bonus added to it.
name: Basalt Armor

description:
You summon a bounty of fruit, vegetables, and fresh water for yourself and your allies. You create enough food to feed up to 10 people and everyone who eats the food heals for 1d4 plus your Signature Ability modifier hit points. To gain the healing, people must eat enough to constitute a full meal.

The food spoils after 24 hours.
name: Nature's Bounty

description: You send a mental message to a creature within 120 feet. The creature then has the opportunity to respond. You do not need to see the creature to cast this, but must know their direction relative to yours.
name: Message

description:
You create a servant out of mist to do your bidding. The servant can move through walls and other barriers as long as they are not airtight. In additional, they have a carrying capacity of 1 bulk and a movement speed of 30 feet.

You can use your action to issue commands to the servant, which with do its best to follow. The servant is mindless and cannot communicate with you in any way. It also may not attack or use magical items.

If the servant goes outside the range of the spell, it dissipates.
name: Mist Servant

description: As a reaction to being hit by a weapon attack, you pull up a protective barrier of ice. Reduce the damage taken by 2d6.
name: Ice Barrier

description:
You briefly turn into a hazy blur before rematerializing in any unoccupied space you can see within range. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the distance you move. For every additional arcanum you spend, the range is extended by 10 feet.
name: Blurstep

description: As a reaction to being hit by a weapon attack, you harden your body, becoming immune to the next instance of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage you take. If not triggered, this spell effect fades at the start of your next turn.
name: Temper Self

description:
As a reaction to creatures falling, you may cast this spell to slow their descent. Their fall speed becomes set at 30 feet per round and they do not take fall damage while this spell is active. You may target up to 5 falling creatures with this spell.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your arcanum limit, to target additional creatures with this spell. You may target 5 additional creatures for every additional arcanum you spend.
name: Feather Fall

description: You gain the ability to speak with, and understand, beasts for the duration of the spell. Beasts can only communicate as well as their intelligence allows them.
name: Speak with Animals

description:
You bless up to 5 willing creatures within range with resistance to acid and necrotic damage.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures. You may target 5 additional creatures per additional arcanum spent.
name: Protection from Decay

description:
Chose up to 4 enemies within range. These enemies must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they have to subtract 1d4 from each of their attack rolls and saving throws while the spell is active.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of creatures affected. You may target one additional creature for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Bane

description: You use magic to mask your intentions. You gain a +4 bonus to Deception checks and your alignment cannot be detected by mundane or magical means.
name: Hide Intent

description:
You launch a bolt of fire at a creature within range. Make a spell attack against their AC. On a hit, the creature takes 2d10 fire damage.

You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of the spell. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Firebolt

description:
You mask the stench and sight of a dead body. This spell hides the marks of death on a corpse and covers it with an illusion to make the body look like a sleeping person. Creatures can make Insight rolls against your character DC to see through the illusion.

This does not mask additional signs of violence, like dismembered limbs or pools of blood.
name: Mask Death

description:
You summon a pool of grease in a 10-foot square area within range. All creatures on the grease must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they are knocked prone.

Creatures must reattempt the save at the start of their turn or the first time they enter the grease on their turn.

The greased ground is considered difficult terrain. If set aflame, the greased ground does 1d10 fire damage to creatures who come in contact with it for the first time on their turns.
name: Grease

description:
Choose an inanimate object no larger than 1 cubic foot and imbue it with light. The object glows, giving off bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light in an additional 20-feet beyond that.

If you cast this spell again before the duration ends, the first object loses its glow.
name: Light

description: You soothe a creature with divine energy, giving them a 1d4 bonus on their next skill check.
name: Guide

description: You harden the air around you, giving you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from weapon attacks until the start of your next turn.
name: Harden Air

description:
You launch a spike of void energy at a creature within range. Make a spell attack against the target, if it hits, they take 1d4 void damage.

You may increase the damage of this spell by 1d4 damage, but you take the additional 1d4 void damage as well.
name: Void Spike

description: Choose up to 5 willing creatures, they become resistant to fire damage for the duration of the spell.
name: Molten Skin

description:
You create an illusion no more than 5 cubic feet in size. You can animate the illusion and have it produce sounds. You may modify the illusions behavior or move it anywhere within range by using an action on following turns.

Creatures can see through the illusion by succeeding a Will save against your character DC or spending an action interacting with it.
name: Lesser Illusion

description: You coat yourself in a thick acidic membrane. Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to acid damage. In addition, whenever a creature successfully hits you with a melee attack, they take 1d6 acid damage in response.
name: Acid Membrane

description:
Choose a creature within range that is not hostile towards you. For the duration of the spell, you have +2 to Persuasion and Deception checks towards them.

Once the spell's duration ends, the targeted creature becomes aware you cast a spell on them.

You may also cast this spell onto inanimate objects. Any creature that comes in contact with the object has the spell cast on them. If you cast the spell on an inanimate object, it remains for 1 hour before fading.
name: Kindle Friendship

description:
You summon unavoidable void missiles to attack creatures within range. You summon 3 missiles that deal 1d4 void damage each. You may have the missiles target one creature or multiple.

You may increase the damage of each individual missile by 1d4 if you take that damage as well, but you must decide this before the missile is fired.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of missiles. You create 1 additional missile for each additional arcanum spent.
name: Void Missiles

description:
You summon a blade made of interwoven thorny vines. As part of casting this spell, you may also make an attack with this weapon. The blade uses your spell attack bonus for attack rolls and deals 1d8 plus your signature ability modifier in piercing damage on hit.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of the weapon. The damage increases by 1d8 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Thornblade

description:
You attempt to frighten a creature within range. The target creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are frightened and must immediately use their reaction to move as far from you as possible.

Frightened creatures cannot willingly move towards you, but may still move laterally.

A frightened creature can reattempt the Will save at the end of following turns to end the effect. Once a creature has succeeded on the Will save, they are immune to the effects of this spell for 24 hours.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature for every additional arcanum you spend.
name: Instill Fear

description:
You summon a sparrow to deliver a message on your behalf. Speak a message of no more than 25 words that the sparrow remembers and give it a location and person to deliver the message to. The location must have been one you have visited previously. The description can be as general or specific as needed, but the sparrow will deliver the message to the first person that matches the description at the given location.

Once the sparrow flies off, it will travel up to 50 miles a day towards the intended destination. Once it finds someone matching the description at the location, it will relay the message in your voice to the creature. If the spell's duration ends before the sparrow can reach the destination, it vanishes.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the duration of this spell. The duration increases by 24 hours for each additional arcanum spent.
name: Sparrow's Wing

description:
You attempt to communicate with your deity or divine spirits for guidance. As part of this spell, you may pose one question about a specific course of action that you may take within the next hour. In response, the DM may choose to respond with an "affirmative", "negative", or "neutral" regarding the course of action as it affects the caster.

The response is based on the situation and environment when the spell is cast and does not account for any changes that may occur between the casting of this spell and the course of action being followed.
name: Divine Guidance

description:
You charge a melee weapon with electricity. For the duration of your spell, the enchanted weapon deals an additional 1d4 lightning damage and is considered magical.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage the weapon deals. The damage increases by 1d4 for every additional arcanum you spend.
name: Electrify Weapon

description:
You create a minor tremor in a 10-foot radius around you. All creatures within the affected area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 1d8 bludgeoning damage and are knocked prone.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the area of effect. The radius increases by 5 feet for each additional arcanum spent.
name: Tremor

description:
You touch a beast, attempting to inhabit and control it. If the beast is unwilling, it may make a Will save against your character DC or negate the effect. The creature can reattempt this save every minute to end the effect.

If you successfully warg into the beast, you can see through its senses and control its actions. While you are inhabiting the beast, your body remains stationary and defenseless. You return to your body when the spell ends or the beast's health becomes 0.

You become aware if your body is harmed while you are inhabiting the beast.
name: Warg

description:
You summon a small wisp that has the ability to illuminate. You may use a bonus action to have the wisp illuminate or darken. When illuminated, the wisp gives off a bright white light in a 20-foot radius and and dim light for a further 20 feet.

You may use your bonus action to move the wisp up to 30 feet as long as it remains with the spell's range. In addition, you may use the same bonus action to illuminate or darken the wisp.

You may have a number of wisps active equal to your Signature Ability modifier and may control all of them with the same bonus action.
name: Illuminating Wisp

description: You launch an icy spear at an enemy. Make a spell attack, on a hit, the creature takes 1d6 cold damage and their movement speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of their next turn.
name: Icicle Spear

description:
You summon a thorny vine to grasp a creature. Choose a creature within range to make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature takes 1d6 piercing damage as vines wrap around them.

If they wish to move on their turn, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 1d6 piercing damage before being able to move as normal. On a success, they are released from the vine and can move normally.
name: Grasping Vine

description: You summon a beam of divine light to damage an enemy. Choose a creature within range to make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 1d8 radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save.
name: Burning Light

description:
You summon fog in a 15-foot radius around you. Creatures within the fog have their visibility reduced to 5 feet. The fog slowly dissipates over the duration but may be removed by moderate-wind speeds.

Creatures in the fog have a +5 bonus to Stealth and a -5 penalty to Perception.
name: Fog

description: You summon a whip of water to strike and pull enemies with. Make a spell attack against an enemy within range. On a hit, they take 1d8 bludgeoning plus 1d4 cold damage and are pulled 5 feet towards you.
name: Water Whip

description:
You heal a creature's bruises and minor wounds. An ally creature within range regains 2d6 hit points.

You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the amount healed. The spell heals for an additional 1d6 hit points for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Lesser Heal

description:
You touch a creature, sending a bolt of electricity through them. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. If you hit, the creature takes 1d6 lightning damage. The spark then jumps to the nearest enemy within 5 feet of the target, dealing the same damage to them as well. It bounces one additional time, for three times total, before disappearing. If there are no other targets in range, it can bounce back to creatures it has already shocked.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of bounces by 1 for each arcanum spent.
name: Spark

description: Your weapon glows with divine light. Until the spell's duration ends, your melee weapon deals an additional 1d4 radiant damage.
name: Holy Weapon

description:
You give the power of levitation to a willing creature of size Medium or smaller, or an inanimate object no larger than 5 square feet and weighing less than 100 pounds. If a creature, they gain the ability to use their movement to move vertically. However, while levitating, they have no control in the horizontal plane and cannot move forward, backwards, or side-to-side.

If you cast this spell on an object, it will float upwards immediately before coming to a stop 30 feet in the air. When the spell ends, if there is a creature below the levitating object, they may make a Reflex save to avoid being damaged by it. On a failure, they take 2d6 bludgeoning damage from the falling object.
name: Levitate

description: Choose up to 4 willing creatures. They gain heal hit points equal to three times the arcanum spent on this spell and gain an equal amount of temporary hit points.
name: Divine Health

description:
You attempt to charm a humanoid creature within range. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, it is charmed by you for the duration of the spell or until you or your allies take a harmful action against it.

Charmed creatures are friendly towards you and will not attack you.

When the spell's duration ends, the creature knows a spell was cast on them.
name: Charm

description:
You envelope a willing creature in divine light. The first time any creature attacks the affected creature, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, their attack fails and they can not attack the affected creature.

If the affected creature makes an attack or aggressive action, this spell ends.
name: Sanctuary

description:
You send a blade in your possession flying through the air's currents. Choose a 5-foot square within range for the blade to inhabit. While it is there, it will automatically attack the nearest enemy within range at the end of your turn. Make an attack roll against the target. On a hit, the blade deals 3d6 slashing damage.

You may move the blade up to 30 feet using a bonus action on following turns as long as the blade stays within range.
name: Dancing Blade

description: You create a magical flame that will not go out. The flame must be positioned on something flammable but it does not consume the object. It gives off heat as normal but can only go out by being quenched or smothered.
name: Everlasting Fire

description:
You launch a bolt of lightning in a 15-foot line starting at your location. All creatures within the line must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d6 lightning damage or half as much on a successful save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the length of the lightning bolt. The length increases by 10 feet for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Lightning Bolt

description:
You cure a creature of a disease or illness. If the illness is magical in nature and the arcanum spent on this spell is less than the arcanum used to create the illness, you must roll a spell attack against it. You must roll equal to or higher than 10 + the arcanum spent to create the illness. If you miss, this spell has no effect.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the power of this spell.
name: Cure Disease

description:
You wrap a willing creature in a cocoon of oak. Until the creature chooses, they are enveloped, restrained, and gain full cover. In addition, at the start of each of their turns, they heal for 6d4 hit points. The creature can choose at any point to end the spell's effect on them.

Reclaim: If the creature regains health beyond their maximum hit points, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Oaken Embrace

description:
You summon a localized cloud of soot to blind a creature within range. The chosen creature makes a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are blinded. They may reattempt the save at the end of their turn to end the effect.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Soot Cloud

description:
As a reaction to spell being cast, you attempt to cancel it. You must be able to see the spell being cast as well as be in range of the caster. If the arcanum you use on this spell is equal to or greater than the arcanum used on the spell you will to cancel, you succeed and the opposing spell is countered and does not activate. If you have spent less arcanum than the opposing spell, you must roll a spell attack. The DC is 10 plus the arcanum spent on the opposing spell.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum on this spell to counter more powerful spells.
name: Counterspell

description:
You attempt to dispel a magical effect or aura. Chose a magical effect or aura you can see (or sense) and attempt to dispel it. If the effect was created using the same or less arcanum than you have put into this spell, it is instantly dispelled.

If the spell was created with more arcanum, you must make a spell attack against the effect. The DC for this attack is 10 plus the arcanum spent on the effect. If you succeed, the effect is ended.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to try and dispel stronger magical effects without having to make a spell attack.
name: Dispel Magic

description:
You summon a shield of frost to guard a willing creature. The shield floats around the creature, granting them +2 AC. Any creature which makes a melee attack against the creature takes 2d8 cold damage in response.

The shield shatters on a critical hit. If the shield shatters, the attacker, if within melee range, takes 4d8 cold damage.

Reclaim: If the shield shatters, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Frost Shield

description: You ignite the blade of a willing creature. Until the end of the spell's duration, the weapon deals an additional 4d10 fire damage on hit.
name: Burning Blade

description:
You attempt to communicate with your deity or divine spirits for guidance. As part of this spell, you may pose one question about a specific course of action that you may take within the next 7 days. The DM responds from the perspective of the being you contacted, giving a truthful opinion of the creature concerning your course of action.

The response is based on the situation and environment when the spell is cast and does not account for any changes that may occur between the casting of this spell and the course of action being followed.
name: Greater Divine Guidance

description:
You summon a storm of hail on a 20 square foot area within range. All creatures within the affected area much make Reflex saves against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d8 cold damage and 4d8 bludgeoning damage. On a success, they take half damage.

The area under the storm is darkened, limiting vision to 20 feet.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the area of the hailstorm. The area increases by 5 square feet per additional arcanum spent.
name: Hailstorm

description:
You summon a large stone golem in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The golem follows your orders to the best of its abilities and takes its turn directly after you in combat.

If the spell's duration ends or the golem drops to 0 hit points, it shatters into stone shards and disappears.

Reclaim: If the golem drops to 0 hit points before the spell's duration completes, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Summon Golem

description:
You attempt to plant a command in a creature's mind. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you are allowed to issue one specific command to the creature, which it will undertake to the best of it's abilities for the duration of the spell.

The first time a creature acts in a manner against your command in a day, it takes 10d6 psychic damage.

The command can be anything you wish as long as it does not result in the death of the commanded creature. Example commands would be to "ring the bell tower every 5 minutes" or "fletch 100 arrows per day.

The spell can be ended as an action by the caster or through the spells restore, cure, or wish.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the duration of this spell. The spell's duration increases by 30 days per additional arcanum spent. If you spend 10 arcanum on this spell, the spell lasts indefinitely or until ended by one of the methods above.
name: Geas

description:
You summon a cloud of ash to block vision. Choose a 15-foot sphere within range for the cloud to appear. While in the cloud, creatures are considered blind and light does not provide any illumination. Creatures looking into the cloud will only see dark clouds.

You may instead chose a small object, no larger than 1 cubic foot, as the target for this spell. If you do, the spell constantly spews ash into a 15-foot sphere around it. The object can be moved and will continue to spew ash as long as the spell is active.
name: Ash Cloud

description:
You fill a dead body, either a corpse or an undead under your control, with necrotic energy until it bursts. You may only target corpses or reanimated bodies under your control with this spell. All creatures within 10 feet of the dead body must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d12 necrotic damage and are poisoned until the end of their next turn. Creatures that succeed the save take half damage and are not poisoned.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d12 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Corpse Burst

description:
You intentionally harm yourself to transfer some of your health to a creature. You take 3d12 necrotic damage, and a creature within range heals for the same amount.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage (and healing of this spell). The damage increases by 1d12 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Transfer Essence

description: You summon a large tidal wave that crashes down on enemies on an area within range. The wave starts at your location and extends outward in a 40-foot cone. All creatures in the area must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d8 cold damage and are knocked prone. Creatures that succeed the save take half damage and are not knocked prone.
name: Tidal Wave

description:
You attempt to modify a creature so that they take additional elemental damage. Choose a creature within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you may choose a type of damage: fire, cold, lightning, acid, poison, necrotic, or radiant. Until the end of the spell, the creature is considered vulnerable to that type of damage.

The creature may reattempt the save at the end of its turn to end the effect.
name: Grant Vulnerability

description:
You summon a cloud of heavy ash and smog in a 30-foot by 30-foot cube within range. The cloud limits sight to 5 feet directly around a creature and obscures any vision into or through it.

Creatures that start their turn in the cloud must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, their Constitution is lowered by 1d4.

Holding your breath does not protect you from the smog as it can still enter your body through your eyes and ears.

The smog is heavy and will sink into open holes and passageways that lead downward. It moves and spreads at a speed of 5 feet per round.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the duration of this spell. The duration increases by 1 minute per additional arcanum spent.
name: Choking Smog

description:
You attempt to freshen and clean up to 5 willing creatures within range. The affected creatures' clothing and skin is cleaned of dirt, blood, and grime. In addition, they take on a pleasant smell.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the amount of people affected. You may target 5 additional creatures per additional arcanum spent.
name: Perfume

description:
You attempt to trick a creature into thinking they are bound by chains. Choose a creature within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they see chains sprout from the ground and shackle them. The creature considers itself restrained.

As an action on its turn, the affected creature can attempt to break the chains. The creature makes a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a success, they break free from the imagined chains and are no longer restrained. Regardless of a success or failure, the creature takes 2d6 psychic damage.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Imagine Chains

description:
You summon a spirit from the outer planes to come and aid you. It takes the form of a beast of CR 1/2 or lower in an unoccupied space within range. The summoned beast must remain within 1 mile of you or will vanish, ending the spell. If the beast falls to 0 hit points, it vanishes and the spell ends.

The beast follows normal rules for summons and acts directly after you in initiative.

Reclaim: If the beast dies before the spell ends, you may use a reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Summon Beast I

description:
You summon a host of spirits that circle you, forming a 15-foot radius aura around you. The shape of the spirits is different for each caster and can be heavily influenced by their faith and alignment.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures as immune to the effects.

The first time a creature enters the aura on a turn or at the start of their turn, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d8 radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d8 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Raging Spirits

description:
You create an eye out of infernal energy. The eye sends you visual information mentally. The eye can look in every direction and has devil's sight of 30 feet.

As a bonus action, you may move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. The eye has no limit as to the distance it can move. The eye can move through small gaps that gasses could fit through but is blocked by solid barriers.
name: Devil's Eye

description:
You instantly transport yourself to a space within range. You do not need to be able to see the spot you are travelling to. If your destination is occupied or blocked, you instead appear in the closest unoccupied space, taking 4d8 bludgeoning damage in the process.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to transport other creatures with you. The creatures traveling with you must be adjacent to you and willing. You may bring one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Dimension Door

description:
You summon a cyclone of wind that rips through the battlefield. Choose a 10 by 10 foot area within range as the landing point for the cyclone. All creatures within the affected area must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d8 slashing damage and 4d8 cold damage. They are also knocked prone. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not knocked prone.

Whenever a creature starts its turn on the twister's space or enters it for the first time on their turn, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC.

As an action on following turns, you may move the twister up to 20 feet in any direction.
name: Twister

description: You may use this spell to begin the process of reattaching a dismembered limb. Over the course of the casting time of the spell, the creature will slowly reattach the limb.
name: Reattach

description:
You touch a creature, sending necrotic energy pulsing through their body and back into yours. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes 12d4 necrotic damage and you heal for the damage dealt.

Reclaim: If the spell overheals you, you may use your bonus action to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Inflict Wounds

description: You grant a willing creature divine help in their next skill check. The target creature has +10 to their next skill check or saving throw.
name: Enhance Skill

description:
You send a large clap of compressed air in a 20-foot cone in front of you. All creatures in the affected area must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 6d6 bludgeoning damage and are pushed back 10 feet. On a success, they take half damage and are only pushed back 5 feet.

If a creature impacts a large object or terrain and cannot be pushed back, they take an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
name: Thunderclap

description: You send out a wave of divine energy, healing all allies within 60 feet of you for 2d6 hit points.
name: Minor Wave of Healing

description:
You reach out and touch a creature, attempting to sap their life force. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, you deal 4d12 necrotic damage to them.

If the creature is not undead or a construct, you gain temporary health equal to the damage dealt.
name: Greater Draining Touch

description:
You attempt to curse a creature with blindness. Choose a creature within range to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they become blind for the duration.

This spell can only be nullified by a remove curse, restoration, or wish spells.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to force the creature to increase the duration of the curse. For each additional arcanum spent, the duration increases by 1 day.
name: Curse of Blindness

description:
You blast a large, 30-foot cone with frigid cold wind. All creatures within the affected area must make Fortitude saves against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d8 cold damage or half as much on a successful save.

Creatures killed by this spell turn into frozen statues.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the range of this spell. The range of the cone is extended by 5 feet per additional arcanum spent.
name: Cone of Cold

description:
You resurrect a dead creature provided it has not been dead for more than 10 days.

The creature must have all vital organs and appendages to be revived in this way.

The creature returns to life with 1 hit point and 0 death saves. However, they also take 2 levels of exhaustion.
name: Resurrect

description:
You summon a bright light at a point you can see within range. The sphere emits light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60-feet. If you cast this spell on an object, the light will move with it.

If any of the light interacts with magically conjured darkness, the intersected darkness is dispelled.
name: Daylight

description: You create a small, protected haven out of magic. The haven you create is 30 square feet and can house 8 creatures of size Large or smaller. You can chose which creatures have access to the inside of the haven and may also camouflage it's appearance with solid colors. The haven does not extend into the ground but does otherwise fully encompass the space. The inside is temperature controlled and sound-proof from the outside world.
name: Minor Haven

description:
You grant a creature the ability to travel through stone. While traveling through stone, all equipment on your person travels with you.

The stone must be large enough to contain your entire body for you to be able to travel through it. While travelling through the stone, you lose your sense of sight and sound. You are only able to sense things that are touching the stone directly and only within a localized area of 10 feet from where you are.

If the stone you are inhabiting is destroyed, or the spell ends while you are within it, you take 6d6 bludgeoning damage and are expelled to the nearest unoccupied space.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to impact multiple people with this spell. You may affect one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Stonewalk

description: You grant a creature the ability to comprehend and speak all languages of any creature they physically touch.
name: Tongues

description:
You summon massive shards of ice from the ground. Starting from you, choose which direction the ice travels, up to 40 feet.

All creatures in the path of the ice must make Reflex saves against your character DC. On a failure, they are thrust to one side of the ice (your choice) and take 4d8 piercing and 4d8 cold damage and are knocked prone. On a success, they take half damage, are not knocked prone, and can choose which side of the ice to end on.

The shards of ice form a wall 10 feet high. Each individual shard has an AC of 10 and 20 hit points. If you allow the spell's duration to complete, the ice becomes permanent.
name: Erupting Ice

description:
You summon an nature spirit that takes the form of a pegasus. The pegasus acts under your command for the duration of the spell but cannot participate in combat as anything other than a steed. If the pegasus hits 0 hit points or the spell's duration expires, the pegasus disappears, leaving any equipment or creatures that were on it at the time.

Before the spell's duration is complete, you may spend 1 additional arcanum to extend the spell's duration by 24 hours.
name: Summon Pegasus

description: You attach living shadows to a melee weapon of a willing creature. For the duration of the spell, the weapon has an additional 10 feet of range and deals an additional 4d4 void damage.
name: Shadow Blade

description: You send tendrils of magic out in all directions, searching for living creatures. You immediately sense any living creatures within 10 feet of you, as long as they have an Intelligence of 2 or higher. You may use your action on following turns to extend this radius by 10 additional feet, to a maximum of 30 feet in all directions.
name: Sense Life

description:
You speak with the spirit of a dead body. For this spell to work, the body must have a head with attached mouth. The body gains animation and remembers everything up until their death. You may ask the body three questions and it will respond to the best of its ability.

The body does not need to speak the same language as you but must needed to have at least an Intelligence of 3 while living.

Once you cast this on a body, you may not cast it on the same body for 24 hours.
name: Speak with Dead

description:
You touch a willing creature, causing them to become invisible. Everything on the creature's person also becomes invisible and remains so while on the character.

The invisibility ends of the creature attacks or casts a spells.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Invisibility

description: You pull a willing creature to you. You must be able to see the creature and have an unoccupied space adjacent to you for the creature.
name: Pull Ally

description:
You attempt to hypnotize all creatures within a 20 square foot area within range. Choose any number of creatures within the affected area to make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they become dazed. A dazed creature has a -5 penalty to all attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks.

The dazed creature can reattempt the save at the end of each of its following turn. On a successful save, they are no longer dazed.

Once a creature succeeds against this spell, they are immune to its effects for 24 hours.
name: Mass Hypnosis

description:
You set a glyph of fire into a 5 square foot on the ground. While casting this, you may specify creatures will not activate this trap. You must be able to specify these creatures by name. Whenever another creature, weighing 5lbs or more, steps onto the glyph, they, and all creatures within 10 feet of the glyph must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d10 fire damage or half as much on a successful save.

If the glyph is not triggered during the duration of the spell, it fades.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.

As a bonus action, you may remove an untriggered glyph to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Flame Glyph

description:
You make a willing creature completely invisible for 1 minute. The creature remains invisible through all actions, hostile or otherwise for the duration of the spell.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures. You may make one additional creature invisible per additional arcanum spent.
name: Greater Invisibility

description:
You summon an ethereal spirit that looks identical to you into any unoccupied space within range. You may also use your bonus action to move the spirit up to your movement speed in any direction. It does not provoke attacks of opportunity, nor is it hindered by walls or difficult terrain.

You may use your bonus action to swap places with the spirit. If you do so, the spell ends.
name: Lesser Phantasma

description:
You summon a guardian made out of ice and snow. The guardian encases you in its protective body, occupying the 8 squares adjacent to you. You have full cover while encased but cannot move from your current location. To reach you, enemies must break at least one of the walls of the Ice Guardian, which has an AC of 12 and 20 hit points.

While inside the ice guardian, you may still attack out without penalty.
name: Summon Ice Guardian

description:
You target a beast or plant of size Huge or smaller, granting them intelligence. If the creature is unwilling, you must make a spell attack against them for this spell to succeed.

On a success, the beast or plant gains an Intelligence of 10. In addition, the target also learns to speak one language of your choice. If the target is a plant, it gains the ability to control its branches, flowers, vines, etc.. It also gains a movement speed of 30 feet.

The increased intelligence can be removed by either a dispel magic or wish spell.
name: Grant Intelligence

description: You fill a creature with poison. Choose a creature within range to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 12d6 acid damage, or half as much on a successful save. They are also considered poisoned for 1 minute.
name: Envenom

description:
You attempt to terrify a creature. The target creature makes a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are terrified and must immediately use their reaction to move as far from you as possible.

The terrified creature may reattempt the save at the end of their turn.

Reclaim: You may use a bonus action to reclaim 1 arcanum by ending the spell early.
name: Terrify

description:
You extend an aura of divine healing in a 20-foot radius around you. When you cast this spell, all allies within the radius, including you, regain 2d6 hit points. You may use your bonus action while this spell is active to target one creature with the aura to regain 2d6 hit points.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
name: Healing Aura

description:
You convert the ground into quicksand, trapping all creatures standing on top of it. Choose a solid 20-foot square area within range to be converted into quicksand. All creatures in the effected area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they are plunged into the quicksand and considered restrained. Creatures that succeed the save may move into any unoccupied space outside the affected area, or choose to remain where they are.

All creatures that start their turn on the quicksand, or enter it for the first time on their turn, must make a Reflex save against your character DC or also be restrained.

As an action, restrained creatures may reattempt the save to pull themselves free from the quicksand.

If you let the spell continue for its entire duration, the quicksand becomes permanent. If you end the spell early, the ground returns to its former state and all trapped creatures are freed.

Reclaim: If you end the spell early, you may use a bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Create Quicksand

description: You turn yourself into a stream of chilling vapor and shoot through enemies. When you cast this spell, you turn into an incorporeal mist and increase your movement speed by 10 feet for the round. You may move through enemies this turn but may not end your movement in occupied squares. Any creature you pass through must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d8 cold damage or half as much on a success. At the end of your turn, you return to your regular form.
name: Vapor Stream

description:
You grant a willing creature a boost to their movement and attacks. The hastened creature may make an additional attack on their turn, their movement speed increases by 20 feet per round, and their AC increases by +2.

When this spell ends, the hastened creature gains 1 level of exhaustion.

Heighten: You may spend addition arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Hasten

description:
You attempt to take control of a monster you can see within range. The monster must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you gain control of them for the spell's duration.

The monster acts as summon for the duration of the spell and you may use your bonus action to command it to take actions. It cannot be commanded to take any action that would directly harm itself.

Whenever the monster takes damage, they may reattempt the Will save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to target multiple monsters with this spell. You may target one additional creature per arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If a creature breaks free of the spell before it's duration is complete, you may use your reaction to gain 1 arcanum.
name: Dominate Monster

description:
You restore a willing creature's physical health or attempt to remove a curse placed on them.

You may choose to have this spell remove a level of exhaustion, remove a curse, or cure a status condition.
name: Restore

description: You enchant a willing creature with the freedom to move unimpeded in all situations. For the duration of the spell, the creature is immune to difficult terrain, ignores opportunity attacks, and gains an additional 20 feet to their speed. In addition, the creature has +4 to Acrobatics checks to avoid being grappled.
name: Freedom of Movement

description:
You attempt to drain the nutrients out of a living creature, causing it to decay and wither. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes 10d4 necrotic damage and you heal for the same amount. In addition, the creature is dazed for 1 minute.

At the end of the creature's turn, it may attempt a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a success, the dazed condition ends.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 2d4 per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: Instead of regaining hit points from this spell, you may instead choose to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Wither

description:
You cover the battlefield in tiny, icy needles. Choose a 20 foot by 20 foot area with range as the target area for this spell. All creatures within the affected area must make Reflex saves against your character DC on the start of their turn. On a failure, they take 2d8 piercing damage and 2d4 cold damage, or half as much on a successful save.

For every 5 feet a creature moves through the icy field, they take 2d4 cold damage regardless of whether they succeeded the saving throw or not.
name: Ice Needles

description:
You heal an unconscious or dying creature for 8d6 hit points. In addition, their death saves are reset to 0.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
name: Preserve Life

description:
You place a ward on a creature, protecting them from death. The first time this creature would drop to 0 hit points, they drop to 1 instead. If you cast this against before the ward is used or the duration ends, the original ward fades.

Reclaim: If the ward is activated, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Death Ward

description: You create a tuning fork that is anchored to your location. The object converted into a tuning fork must be inanimate and no larger than 1 cubic foot.
name: Create Tuning Fork

description:
Undead hands sprout from the earth in an 20-foot by 20-foot area you can see within range. All creatures within the affected area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d12 necrotic damage and are restrained. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not restrained.

The first time a creature enters the area on a turn or if it starts it's turn there, they must reattempt the save. On a failure, they take 3d12 necrotic damage and are restrained. On a success, they take half damage and are not restrained.

The affected area is considered difficult terrain for all creatures except undead.
name: Grasping Hands

description:
You summon a ray of sunlight on 5-foot square you can see within range. Any creature touched by the ray must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 6d8 radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save.

You may use your action on following turns to move the ray up to 20 feet anywhere within range.

If it is a sunny day and you are outside when you cast this spell, the damage increases by 2d8.
name: Ray of Sunlight

description:
You attempt to modify the memory of a creature. The creature must have an Intelligence of 3 or higher for this spell to have any effect.

The target must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you may modify the creature's last 10 minutes of memory however you see fit. This spell can be used to have the creature forget specific events that have occurred or even remember them differently.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the range at which you can go back for the memory you may modify. If you spend 1 addition arcanum, the length increase by 1 hour. If you spend 2 arcanum, the length increases by 1 day. 3 arcanum increases the length by 1 week, 4 by 1 year, and 5 additional arcanum allows you to modify any 10-minute piece of memory within the creature's life.
name: Modify Memory

description:
You attempt to hear the thoughts of a creature you can see within range. The creature must be humanoid and have an Intelligence of 4 or higher. It does not need to speak the same language as you.

The creature makes a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you gain access to their surface level thoughts. You may spend an action to dive deeper, finding hidden thoughts and motivations that would otherwise be hidden to you.
name: Read Thoughts

description:
You launch an expanding ball of water into the air before dropping it on a 15-foot square area within range. All creatures within the affected area must make Fortitude saves against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d8 cold damage and are knocked prone. On a success, they take half damage and are not knocked prone.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the spell's damage. The damage increases by 1d8 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Aquabomb

description:
You reanimate a corpse or skeleton of a size Medium or smaller humanoid, converting it into an undead servant that follows your command. If you cast this on a corpse, you create a Zombie, or you create a Skeleton if cast on a pile of bones.

The undead creature is under your control. It takes its turn directly after you in combat, and you may use a Bonus Action to issue commands to it, such as movement and attack targets. If you control multiple undead, you may give them all a command using a Bonus Action, but it must be the same command. If you give your undead no commands, they will stay still and defend themselves.

Before the spell's duration ends, you may cast this spell again to maintain control over your undead. If you cast the spell in this way, it targets 4 undead, instead of just one. If you do not reassert control of your undead, they turn into mindless undead when the spell's duration ends.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to create multiple undead. For each additional arcanum you spend, you may target one additional corpse or skeleton to be animated.
name: Create Undead

description:
You summon wind spirits to locate a creature. You must be familiar enough with the creature to name them specifically or describe them.

The spell will be able to locate the creature, or one matching the description, if they are within 1 mile of you. The spirits will tell you the direction and distance to the creature at the point of casting the spell, but will not give you any additional information if the creature moves away.
name: Locate Creature

description:
You summon a tiny wisp to stand guard over a person or location.

If the wisp is set to guard a location, it will mentally notify you when any other creature goes into or out of the location with a brief description. Creatures can attempt to avoid the wisp by rolling Stealth checks against your character DC.

If the wisp is set to guard a person, it will follow the person as long as they remain on the same plane. It will also send you a mental notification whenever another creature is within 5 feet of the guarded target. Once again, creatures can attempt to void the wisp by rolling Stealth checks against your character DC.

The wisp will only mentally notify you if you are within 10 miles of the wisp's location.
name: Guardian Wisp

description:
You transmute raw, unliving material into a different material. You can use this spell to transmute up to 10 cubic feet of one material into another raw material. When the material transforms, the amount of overall material is reduced by one-tenth.

If you transmute 10 cubic feet of iron into gold, it will transmute into approximately 1 cubic feet of gold.
name: Transmute

description:
You attempt to take control of a creature within range. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, their eyes and nearby skin turns black as you take control of them. You may immediately direct the target to make an attack against anyone you wish within range. You may do this on following turns as well by using your action to direct the creature.

At the end of their turn, they may reattempt the save to end the spell's effect.
name: Force Betrayal

description: You create a magical lens that, when looked through, shows magical objects as having a distinct aura. The brightness of the aura is dependent on the strength of the magical enchantment on the object. The lens cannot detect magical objects through walls but can see past fabric and sheets.
name: Magical Lens

description: You attempt to create a link between you and another creature within range. The target creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you create a link with it, dealing 2d12 necrotic damage and healing for half the amount (rounded down). On following turns, you may use your action to repeat the effect; however, if you do, the creature may reattempt the save at the end of your turn.
name: Steal Essence

description:
You temporarily become one with the earth, gaining nutrients and health. You regain 4d4 hit points when you cast this spell. You may repeat the effect as a bonus action on following turns.

Your speed is 0 for the duration of the spell.
name: Enrich Self

description:
You attempt to banish another creature to a separate plane. Choose a creature within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are banished.

If the creature is native to the plane of existence you are currently on, they are transported to the Astral plane. Otherwise, they are sent back to their plane of origin.

If the spell ends before the duration has completed, the creature returns to the space it was banished from or to the nearest unoccupied space. If the spell is allowed to complete, the creature does not return, even if it was banished from its home plane.

Reclaim: If the spell is allowed to complete, you may use your bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Banishment

description:
You attempt to charm a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature is charmed by you for the duration of the spell. The creature will not act hostile or take aggressive actions towards you while charmed. The charm ends if the creature is harmed by you or your allies.

If the creature was hostile towards you before you cast this spell, the creature gets a +4 bonus to its Will save.

When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Greater Charm

description:
You transform a creature into a different form. If the creature is unwilling, they must make a Will save against your character DC to resist the effect.

The transformation lasts for the duration of the spell but can be ended early by the caster or if the target drops to 0 hit points while in the new form.

The new form can be any creature of similar or less strength than the original creature. When transformed, the creature's abilities and attributes are fully replaced by those available to the new form.

If the creature drops to 0 hit points while in the new form, they transform back and return to their previous value of hit points. Any excess damage is then carried over.

This spell cannot target an unconscious or dying creature.
name: Polymorph

description:
You enter the dreams of a creature you are familiar with. While there, you have the ability to speak to the creature as well as shape their dreams.

The creature must be one you are familiar with and they must be asleep at the time this spell is cast. You do not need to have sight of the creature but they must be on the same plane as you. If the creature is, on average, hostile towards you, they may make a Will save against your character DC. On a success, they resist the effect.

On successfully entering the creature's dream, you have the ability to modify the dream or converse with them. If you convert the dream into a nightmare or conjure scenarios that can harm the creature, the creature may make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d6 psychic damage. On a success, they take no damage.

A creature that is damaged in their dreams may make a Fortitude save against their own character DC. On a success, they wake up, you are ejected from their dream, and the spell ends. On a failure, the dream and spell continue.

When a creature wakes up, they will remember the dream for the next day before it fades.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to have the creature remember the dream for longer. The creature will remember the dream for an extra week per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If you do not cause the creature any damage through the spell, you may use a bonus action to regain 2 arcanum when the spell completes.
name: Dreamwalk

description:
You attempt to calm the emotions of any humanoid in the target area. All creatures within the chosen area must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, their emotions are calmed and they are no longer considered hostile towards you. Instead, you can use this spell to end one of the following effects: frightened, charmed, or even barbarian's Rage.

When the spell ends, all creatures affected know a spell was cast on them.
name: Calm Emotions

description: You cover your eyes in a thin layer of ice that protects them from corrosive, non-magical effects. The lenses created also allow you to see up to 30 feet in darkness and clouds of mist, ash, fog, or poison, as if they were not there.
name: Misty Lens

description: You send a vine filled with healing energy to a creature within range. The target heals for 2d4 hit points.
name: Nourishing Vine

description:
You gift a willing creature with the power of flight. Until the spell ends, the creature has a flying speed of 60 feet.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If you end this spell before half of it's duration has completed, you may use a bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Fly

description:
You grant up to 5 willing creatures shields of holy light. These creatures gain +2 AC and 10 temporary hit points while the spell is active.

Reclaim: If all creatures use their temporary hit points before the spell's duration ends, you regain 1 arcanum.
name: Shields of Light

description:
You hide a creature from magical scrying. While under the effects of this spell, all attempts at locating the creature through magical means fail. In addition, spells such as message and sending fail.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Fade

description:
You grant a willing creature the gift of premonition. For the duration of the spell, the creature has a +4 bonus to all saving throws.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Premonition

description:
You combine two undead under your control into a large undead amalgam. The amalgam is a size Large undead which acts as any other summons, taking it's turn directly after you in combat.

You may use your bonus action to give the amalgam commands as long as it is within 60 feet of you. If given no commands, the amalgam will attempt to fulfill the last command you gave it or, if no commands are relevant, will defend itself.

When the spell's duration ends, or the amalgam reaches 0 hit points, it dissolves into a pile of decaying sinew and bones.

Reclaim: When the amalgam dissolves, you may use your reaction to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Create Undead Amalgam

description:
You summon a spirit from the outer planes to come and aid you. It takes the form of a beast of CR 1 or lower in an unoccupied space within range. The summoned beast must remain within 1 mile of you or will vanish, ending the spell. If the beast falls to 0 hit points, it vanishes and the spell ends.

The beast follows normal rules for summons and acts directly after you in initiative.

Reclaim: If the beast dies before the spell ends, you may use a reaction to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Summon Beast II

description: You summon a powerful gust that pushes all creatures. Mark a 25-foot line with you at the center. All creatures within 10 feet on one side of the line must make Fortitude saves against your character DC. On a failure, they are pushed 30 feet away from you, or half as far on a successful save.
name: Powerful Gust

description:
You launch a ball of expanding fire that erupts with an exploding at a point within range. Choose a point within range as the target for this spell. All creatures within a 20-foot radius of that point must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 5d10 fire damage or half as much on a successful save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of the fireball. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Fireball

description:
You send a message to a creature you are familiar with. The message must be 25 words or less. Once the message is delivered, the creature may send a 25 word response.

This spell works across any distance but has a 30% chance to fail when messaging someone in another plane.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the length of the message and response. The message can be 25 words longer for every additional arcanum spent.
name: Sending

description:
You grow a flower anywhere you can see within range to act as a guardian for you. Whenever a creature is within 5 feet of the flower, you receive a mental notification. The flower is unable to tell you the exact creature within range but can give you information such as size, race, and amount of metal on them.

You may use an action on following turns to have the flower emit a noxious gas. All creatures within 5 feet of the flower must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d6 acid damage and are poisoned.

You may only have one flower active at at time. If you grow a second flower, you lose your connection with the original one.
name: Petal Watcher

description:
You protect a creature in a protective chrysalis. Choose a creature you can see within range. If the creature is unwilling, they may attempt a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, or if the creature is willing, the creature is encased in a crystal. The creature is restrained but also has full cover and immunity to all damage.

If the creature is unwilling, they may reattempt the Will save at the end of each of their turns to end the effect.
name: Chrysalis

description: This spell specifically counteracts spells with "curse" in the name, ending their effect.
name: Remove Curse

description:
You attempt to curse a creature with weakness. Choose a creature within range to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 1 level of exhaustion.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to force the creature to take multiple levels of exhaustion. For each additional arcanum spent, the spell attempts to inflict an additional level of exhaustion. If you heighten this spell, the target may attempt a save for each level of exhaustion.
name: Curse of Weakness

description:
You summon a molten golem to fight by your side. The golem's stats can be provided to you by the DM.

The golem acts as any other summon and takes it's turn immediately after you in combat.
name: Summon Molten Golem

description:
You bless the earth, purifying all terrain within range. Any difficult terrain transforms into regular terrain. In addition, allies that short or long rest on this terrain gain an additional 10d6 hit points and heal an additional point of exhaustion.

Once the spell's duration ends, the earth returns to normal.
name: Radiant Earth

description: You craft an igloo out of summoned snow. The igloo is 20 square feet and has enough room inside for 10 creatures of size Large or smaller. The temperature inside the igloo is regulated and you control which creatures can enter.
name: Igloo

description:
You summon a thunderstorm above you. As part of casting this spell, choose any square within range. All creature on that square and within 5 feet must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d8 lightning damage or half as much on a success. If it is already storming, the spell's damage increases by 1d8.

You may repeat this ability on following turns using your action.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d8 per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If this spell hits at least 5 creatures, you may use your bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Lightning Storm

description:
You attempt to revive a creature that has recently died. This spell only works on creatures which have died within the last minute and are not missing any vital organs.

The creature returns to life with 1 hit point and 0 death saves. However, they also take 2 levels of exhaustion.
name: Revivify

description:
You enchant a willing creature so that the air they inhale is automatically filtered. They are no longer affected by spells that conjure clouds of smoke or other harmful substances. In addition, this allows the creature to filter air from water, granting them the ability to breathe underwater.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Filter Air

description:
You attempt to whisper an idea to a creature, forcing them to become obsessive about it. Come up with a single sentence, no more than 10 words as your compulsion, and choose a creature within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they become obsessed with the sentence.

An obsessed creature will spend the duration of the spell thinking about the compulsion and acting on it in any ways they can. They will lose sleep thinking about it and become too preoccupied to handle their responsibilities.

The compulsion can be as simple as "Birds are not real." to more complex thoughts such as "Your guards are secretly demons plotting to kill you."

If your compulsion leads the creature to attempt harm against another creature or themselves, they may reattempt the save. On a success, the spell is broken.

A creature which passes the save for this spell is immune to it's effects for 24 hours.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the duration of this spell. The spell's duration increases by 8 hours per additional arcanum spent.
name: Compulsion

description:
As a reaction to being targeted by a melee attack, you may attempt to move the attacker out of range. The attacker must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are knocked back up to 20 feet and their attack automatically misses.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the distance a creature is pushed back. The creature is pushed back an additional 10 feet per additional arcanum spent.
name: Displace

description:
You curse a creature with a powerful rot. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature is cursed and their maximum hit points are cut in half (rounded down). The creature's Charisma is also lowered by 2 as their skin begins to fall of and they emit a powerful odor.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the duration of this curse. The duration increases by 1 week per additional arcanum spent.
name: Curse of Rot

description:
You attempt to take control of a humanoid you can see within range. The humanoid must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you gain control of them for the spell's duration.

The humanoid acts as summon for the duration of the spell and you may use your bonus action to command it to take actions. It cannot be commanded to take any action that would directly harm itself.

Whenever the creature takes damage, they may reattempt the Will save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to target multiple humanoids with this spell. You may target one additional creature per arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If a creature breaks free of the spell before it's duration is complete, you may use your reaction to gain 1 arcanum.
name: Dominate Person

description:
You cover a willing creature within range in burning fire. The creature gives off a fiery aura in a 5-foot radius that burns all creatures. The first time a creature comes in contact with the aura, and on the beginning of their turn, they must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 3d10 fire damage, or half as much on a successful save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Flame Body

description:
You attempt to take control of a beast you can see within range. The beast must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you gain control of them for the spell's duration.

The beast acts as summon for the duration of the spell and you may use your bonus action to command it to take actions. It cannot be commanded to take any action that would directly harm itself.

Whenever the beast takes damage, they may reattempt the Will save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to target multiple beasts with this spell. You may target one additional creature per arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If a creature breaks free of the spell before it's duration is complete, you may use your reaction to gain 1 arcanum.
name: Dominate Beast

description:
You create an illusion meant to frighten creatures. Choose a 20-foot square within range. All creatures within that space must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are frightened by the image you conjured and must immediately use their reaction to move away from the image, which appears at the center of the targeted area.
