Anyone who failed the save and is concentrating on a spell must make a Concentration check.
name: Frighten Mass

description:
You lower a creature's body temperature until they slow to a crawl. Choose a creature within range, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are slowed. They gain a -2 AC penalty, their speed is cut in half, and they may only take an action or bonus action on their turn. If the creature uses an action to attack, they may only make one attack.

The affected creature may reattempt the Will save at the end of their turn to end the effect.
name: Slow

description: You summon an ice elemental to fight alongside you. It appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The elemental takes its turn directly after you in combat. If the spell ends or the elemental's hit points drop to 0, it disappears.
name: Summon Ice Elemental

description:
You create an illusion up to 20 cubic feet in size. You can animate the illusion and have it produce sounds. You may modify the illusions behavior or move it anywhere within range by using an action on following turns.

Creatures can see through the illusion by succeeding a Will save against your character DC or spending an action interacting with it.
name: Greater Illusion

description:
You summon a wall of fire to divide the battlefield. The wall is 60 feet long, 15 feet high, and can take any shape you want as long as all parts of it are within the spell's range. When casting this spell, choose one side of the wall to be the damaging side. Whenever a creature starts their turn, or enters for the first time, within 10 feet of the wall on the damaging side, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 6d10 fire damage or half as much on a success.

The wall blocks visibility between sides and if a creature crosses over the wall, they take an additional 6d10 fire damage.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to extend the length of the wall. The wall's length increase by 20 feet per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: Whenever a creature crosses over the fall, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Wall of Fire

description:
You convert an undead zombie or skeleton under your control into a wight. The wight is stronger than regular undead but still follows regular summon and undead rules as defined in create undead. The DM has the stats for a wight.

If you have a wight under your control, you may cast this spell to reassert control of up to four of them for an additional 24 hours. If you do not, the wight becomes a mindless undead no longer under your control when the spell's duration expires.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to create multiple wights. You may convert one additional undead into a wight per additional arcanum spent. If you use this spell to reassert control of a wight, you may spend additional arcanum to target multiple wights. You may reassert control over 4 additional wights per additional arcanum spent.
name: Create Wight

description:
You become a supercharged ball of electricity. Your movement speed increases by 20 feet and the ability to move through all creatures. Every creature you move through must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 6d8 lightning damage, or half as much on a successful save. A creature can only be affected by this spell once on your turn.

Reclaim: If you move through three or more creatures on your turn while this spell is active, you may use your bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Lightning Step

description:
You surround yourself in protective gusts of wind. When you cast this spell, chose up to 5 creatures which are unaffected by this spell. Whenever any other creature gets within 10 feet of you while this spell is active, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are rebuffed and their movement speed is reduced to 0 for the remainder of their turn.

If you move within 10 feet of a creature, this spell does not activate.
name: Protective Gusts

description:
As a reaction to a creature speaking, you attempt to discover if they are lying or not. The target creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you learn whether they believe the last statement they said was true or not.

Creatures do not know they have had this spell cast on them.
name: Discover Deceit

description:
You create a wall of ice. The wall is 10 feet high and can be any shape you want, but no longer than 90 feet. If you use the wall to trap or enclose creatures, those creatures may make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a success, they can move to any space outside the enclosing wall.

Each section of wall has an AC of 10 and 20 hit points. Breaking one 5-foot segment of the wall does not impact other pieces.

If you let the spell complete it's duration, the ice wall remains permanently. Otherwise, it disappears when the spell ends.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the length of this wall. The length increases by 20 feet per additional arcanum spent.
name: Wall of Ice

description:
You summon massive roots from the earth to grapple your enemies. Choose up to 5 creatures of size Large or smaller within range. They must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they are restrained by roots and take 3d8 bludgeoning damage.

Any creatures restrained in this way take an additional 3d8 bludgeoning damage on the start of their turns. At the end of their turns, they may make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a success, they are freed.
name: Raging Roots

description:
You summon a rain of burning oil to cover a large area. Choose a 30 square foot area within range. All creatures within the affected area must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 2d10 fire damage, or half as much on a success.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time, or starts their turn within it, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 2d10 fire damage.

All flammable objects which are not worn alight at the cast of this spell.
name: Rain of Fire

description:
You heal a creature within range for 6d6 hit points.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
name: Heal

description:
You attempt to cause a creature combust into a ball of fire. Choose a creature with range, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage.

If this damage kills the creature, the damage extends to all other creatures within a 5-foot radius of the target.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: If this spell kills it's initial target, you may use your bonus action to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Combustion

description:
You attempt to hold a monster of size Huge or smaller in place. Choose a creature within range as the target. They must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they are restrained.

A creature under the effect of this spell may reattempt the save at the end of their turn. On a success, the spell's effects end.

Reclaim: If the target creature breaks free of the spell before the duration completes, you may use your reaction to regain 1 arcanum.
name: Hold Monster

description: You send out a wave of divine energy, healing all allies within 60 feet of you for 4d6 hit points.
name: Wave of Healing

description:
You grant a willing creature within range immunity to fire and acid damage for the duration of the spell.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures. You may target 1 additional creature per arcanum spent.
name: Infernal Immunity

description:
You summon plate mail out of ice to cover a willing creature. The creature's AC is set to 18 (excluding bonuses from shields or other abilities) for the duration of the spell. The creature becomes resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. All non-magical damage the creature takes is reduced by 4.

If a weapon attack against the creature is a critical hit, the armor shatters, and the spell ends.

Reclaim: If the armor shatters before the spell's duration is complete, you may use your reaction to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Ice Knight's Armor

description:
You, and up to 9 willing creatures, are transported to the Ethereal Plane. This plane sits directly on top of the Material plane but does not interact with it in any way.

While in the Ethereal plane, you may move through solid surfaces as well as sink through the floor if you so choose. While on the Ethereal plane, you may only interact with other creatures and objects on the Ethereal plane.

When this spell ends, any creatures in spaces that are occupied on the Material plane take 10d8 bludgeoning damage and are pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.
name: Ethereal Walk

description: You surround a willing creature in swirling winds. For the duration of the spell, the target creature's AC is increased by 10 against all ranged attacks.
name: Whirlwind Barrier

description:
You summon chains of white-hot metal to restrain a creature. The creature makes a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature is restrained and takes 6d10 fire damage.

The creature takes the damage again at the start of each of its turns if it is still restrained.

The creature may also attempt to break free by using an action on its turn to reattempt the Reflex save against your character DC.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of the chains. The damage increases by 2d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Infernal Chains

description:
You attempt to curse a creature to remove their ability to fly. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature's fly speed is set to 0 for the duration of the curse.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the duration of the curse. The duration increases by 30 days per additional arcanum spent.
name: Curse of Grounding

description: You attempt to cause a creature to rapidly decay. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes 6d6 necrotic damage and 6d6 acid damage. The creature is also poisoned and gains 1 level of exhaustion.
name: Decompose

description:
You gain the ability to connect two large plants or trees you have touched and creating a portal between them.

The portal lasts until the end of your next turn and anyone who enters it will be immediately transported to the other plant.

The two plants must be on the same plane.
name: Transport via Plants

description:
You summon a powerful celestial guardian into an unoccupied space within range.

The guardian is different from other summons in that you do not control it using bonus action commands. Thought it takes its turn immediately after you, it acts freely of its own accord and will prioritize healing and defending you over attacking other creatures.

The DM has the stats for the Celestial Guardian.
name: Summon Celestial Guardian

description:
You summon a spirit from the outer planes to come and aid you. It takes the form of a beast of CR 3 or lower in an unoccupied space within range. The summoned beast must remain within 1 mile of you or will vanish, ending the spell. If the beast falls to 0 hit points, it vanishes and the spell ends.

The beast follows normal rules for summons and acts directly after you in initiative.

Reclaim: If the beast dies before the spell ends, you may use a reaction to regain 3 arcanum.
name: Summon Beast III

description:
You lock eyes with a creature, attempting to rip its soul from its body. The creature makes a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature takes 8d12 + 20 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.

If this damage kills the creature, you may use your bonus action to raise the corpse of the creature as a zombie under your control or entrap the spirit as a ghoul under your control. Both of these creatures follow normal rules of a summon as well as the rules for an undead as shown in create undead.
name: Sever Soul

description:
You attempt to cause a creature combust into a ball of fire. Choose a creature with range, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage.

If this damage kills the creature, the damage extends to all other creatures within a 15-foot radius of the target. If those targets also die, this effect repeats.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 1d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Chain Combustion

description:
You create a large estate in a demiplane of ice that lasts for the duration. The entrance can be anywhere within the range of the spell and takes the form of a wooden doorway that only you, and creatures you designate, can see.

The demiplane is a brightly light tundra. You have full control of the floor plan for the estate, including number of floors, rooms, and passages.

The estate is equipped with 100 misty servants that will follow your commands, but are not permitted to attack or harm other creatures. The estate has enough food and resources to feed up to 50 people for 24 hours.

When this spell ends, any creatures inside the demiplane are expelled. Any items left inside remain until the spell is cast again.
name: Frozen Estate

description:
You attempt to forcibly age a creature. The target creature must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they age 1d6 years.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the amount the creature ages. The creature ages an additional 1d6 years per additional arcanum spent.
name: Age

description:
You create a bubble of void energy that negates all magic. The field is a sphere 20-feet in diameter centered on a point you can see within range. All magical effects within the field stop working and magical effects cannot penetrate the sphere.

Creatures that are summoned, conjured, or animated by magic instantly disappear if inside the sphere when it is cast or when they attempt to cross its threshold.

Magical items lose functionality within the sphere and all magical effects that allow teleportation or divination into the sphere fail automatically.

Spells with areas of effect partially overlapping the sphere still trigger but the magical effect does not reach the sphere or anything within it.

Spells which dispel magic or magical effects do not work on the antimagic field.

Two antimagic fields can intersect without causing issues.
name: Antimagic Field

description:
You summon a divine flame in your hand, illuminating the area within 60 feet of you. All allies within the light's range regain 4d6 hit points at the beginning of their turns. All enemies within the light's range must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 4d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a success. Regardless of if they saved or not, the all of the area the light touches is difficult terrain for enemies.

You may use an action on following turns to repeat the effect.
name: Divine Torch

description: You create a telepathic link with a willing creature. For the duration of the spell, you and the target have the ability to converse telepathically. This ability works over any distance and across planes.
name: Telepathic Link

description: You create a bubble of air up to 50-feet in diameter. All non-magical missiles (arrows, crossbow bolts) that are targeting spaces within the bubble automatically bounce off. Missiles from within the bubble can travel through without issue.
name: Pressure Bubble

description:
You attempt to turn a creature to stone. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, their body begins to petrify. Over the course of the next three turns, they begin to turn to stone.

At the beginning of each of the turns, the creature can make a Will save against your character DC to delay the effect for 1 turn.

At the end of their first turn, their legs petrify, reducing their movement speed to 0.

At the end of their second turn, their arms petrify.

At the end of their third turn, they have fully turned into a stone statue.

This spell can only be broken by a restore, cure, or wish spell.
name: Turn to Stone

description:
You reanimate a corpse or skeleton of a size Medium or smaller beast, converting it into an undead gargoyle that follows your command.

The stats for a gargoyle can be provided to you by your DM. The undead gargoyle acts as a summon, taking it's turn directly after you in combat.

Before the spell's duration ends, you may cast this spell again to maintain control over your undead. If you cast the spell in this way, it targets 4 undead, instead of just one. If you do not reassert control of your undead, they turn into mindless undead when the spell's duration ends.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to create multiple undead. For each additional arcanum you spend, you may target one additional corpse or skeleton to be animated.
name: Create Gargoyle

description: You create a burst of expanding wind at a point you can see within range. All creatures within 20 feet of the point must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are pushed back to the edge of the 20-foot radius and take 6d8 bludgeoning damage.
name: Wind Burst

description:
You summon a blizzard which covers an 50 foot by 50 foot area within range. All creatures within the area have their sight limited to 10-feet and the area is considered difficult terrain as snow and hail begin to come down.

The first time a creature enters the affected space on a turn or when they start their turn in the affected area, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d8 cold damage and 8d8 bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a successful save.
name: Blizzard

description:
You attempt to adapt the body of up to 10 willing creatures. The creatures automatically change to survive and thrive in the current environment. The general shape and muscular structure of the creatures does not change.

For example, if the terrain is extremely hot and filled with ash, the creatures adapt to resist the heat and develop film over their eyes to not be affected by the ash-filled air. Same way, if the creatures are in or near water, they may develop a swim-speed and gills to be able to breathe underwater.

It is up to the DM's discretion to decide what attributes the creatures get and which environmental hazards are too dangerous to be able to be adapted to.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target additional creatures. You may target 5 additional creatures per additional arcanum spent.
name: Adapt

description:
You summon a pillar of void energy at an unoccupied space within range. The pillar has a 10-foot diameter and is 50 feet tall.

All creatures within 30 feet of the pillar at the start of their turns must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, a void tendril grabs them, dealing 10d4 void damage to them and moving them. The creature is automatically moved to the other side of the pillar and the same distance away.
name: Twilight Pillar

description:
You summon 8 void tentacles from your chest. The tentacles reach out, targeting the 8 closest creatures within 60 feet, prioritizing enemies. Make an attack roll for each tentacle against the individual creatures' AC. On a hit, the target takes 6d10 void damage and are knocked prone.

For each tentacle that does not find a target, you take 2d10 void damage.
name: Void Tentacles

description:
You, and up to 9 additional creatures of your choice, may choose to hide within a reflective surface. While within this reflective surface, you have access to a space similar to the one you just left but cannot influence the outside world. Anyone who looks into the reflective surface will see you within it.

If the reflective surface is shattered, each creature hiding within it takes 6d6 psychic damage and is ejected into the nearest unoccupied space. Creatures are ejected in the order they entered.
name: Reflective Sanctuary

description:
You suggest a simple course of action to up to 10 creatures. Each of these creatures must have at least an Intelligence of 3 for the spell to have any effect on them. Each creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, the creatures are charmed by you and will consider your requests as those from a trusted friend.

Whenever a creature that is charmed in this way takes damage, they may reattempt the save.
name: Mass Suggestion

description: You give up to 10 willing creatures true sight. True sight allows creatures to see through all magical effects such as illusions and invisibility.
name: True Sight

description:
You enhance a melee weapon with necrotic energy. For the duration of the spell, the weapon deals an additional 2d12 necrotic damage and you heal for half the necrotic damage dealt.

Reclaim: If you would be healed above your maximum hit points, you may use a reaction to reclaim 1 arcanum.
name: Rotting Blade

description:
You grant a willing creature the ability to succeed nearly any skill check. For the duration of the spell, whenever the target makes a skill check, they may replace the rolled value with a 15, adding modifiers afterwards.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to target multiple creatures with this spell. You may target one additional creature per additional arcanum spent.
name: Mastery

description: You attempt to invert a creature's physiology. A target creature within range makes a Will save. On a failure, for the duration of the spell, all healing magic deals damage to them instead.
name: Invert Life

description: You attempt to send a powerful shock through a creature. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes 12d6 lightning damage.
name: Electric Touch

description:
You may teleport yourself and up to 10 willing creatures within range to any location on another plane of existence provided you have a tuning fork for that location.

You may also use this spell to teleport objects as long as they can all fit within a 10-foot cube within range.
name: Planar Transport

description: You summon a massive tsunami originating at yourself and extending outward in a 100-foot cone. All creatures of size Huge or smaller must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d8 cold damage and are pushed backward 60 feet. Creatures which succeed the save take half damage but are not pushed back.
name: Tsunami

description:
You grant up to 10 willing creatures a blessing. For the duration of the spell, they are immune to fire and acid damage. Whenever a blessed creature is targeted by a melee attack, the attacker takes 4d10 fire damage in response.

In addition, they do not feel any climate effects due to heat.
name: Blessing of the Inferno

description:
You exhale an inferno of fire in a 30-foot cone. All creatures within the affected area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage, or half as much on a successful save.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the damage of this spell. The damage increases by 2d10 per additional arcanum spent.
name: Dragon's Breath

description: You launch five supercharged bursts of wind at creatures within range. Make a spell attack against each targeted creature. On a hit, the creature takes 5d8 slashing damage.
name: Wind Slice

description:
You create a wind tunnel that connects two points. One end of the tunnel opens at your feet and the other at a point you can see within range. Whenever a creature steps into one of the ends of the tunnel, they are transported to the other point.

This movement through the tunnel does not provoke attacks opportunity.
name: Wind Tunnel

description:
You summon bubbling magma at a 20 foot by 20 foot area you can see within range. The affected area becomes difficult terrain and cracks begin to appear in the earth. You may use a bonus action to activate the spell, causing a plume of lava to burst forth and damage all creatures within the affected area. All creatures within the area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage, or half as much on a successful save.

For each round you delay reactivating the spell, the damage increases by 2d10, up to three times for a total of 6d10 additional damage.

If your concentration on the spell is broken before you can activate it, it will activate but deals no additional damage.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the area affected by this spell. The area increases by an additional 10 feet on each side each additional arcanum spent.
name: Lava Plume

description:
You create a copy of yourself out of snow. The creature you create has the same attributes, stats, and abilities you had when you started casting this spell. Unlike you, the simulacrum does not have copies of your weapons, armor, or magical items.

The copy is friendly to you and will obey your commands. Unlike a summon, the simulacrum can act on its own. It may also not participate in rests or be healed in any way.

The simulacrum may be healed by spending arcanum over the course of 1 hour. It heals for 1 hit dice plus your Constitution modifier per arcanum spent.

If reduced to 0 hit points, the simulacrum melts into a pile of water and snow.
name: Simulacrum

description:
You may teleport yourself and up to 10 willing creatures within range to any location you have previously been to, as long as it is on the same plane of existence as you are.

You may also use this spell to teleport objects as long as they can all fit within a 10-foot cube within range.
name: Teleport

description:
You send a bolt of void energy at a target. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, they take 20d4+40 void damage.

If this damage kills the creature, they are disintegrated.

Reclaim: If you kill a creature with this spell, you may use your bonus action to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Disintegrate

description:
You create a massive illusion up to 1 square mile in length. You may completely change how the terrain looks, from hiding buildings to creating images of large fields.

If your illusion includes environmental hazards and a creature is affected by one, they must make a Will save against your character DC. On a success, they see through the illusion. On a failure, they take 4d6 psychic damage and believe the hazard is real.

Creatures can attempt to see through the illusion my succeeding an Insight check against your character DC.
name: Illusory Terrain

description: All allies within 500 feet of you that are currently dying become unconscious and have their death saves reset to 0.
name: Wave of Life

description: You grant a willing creature wings. The creature gains a flying speed of 100 feet for the duration of the spell.
name: Wings

description:
You attempt to cure a willing creature of all curses and diseases. If the arcanum spent on this spell is greater than or equal to the arcanum spent on each individual disease or curse, they are cured. If the arcanum on any of the diseases or curses is greater than the arcanum on this spell, you must roll a spell attack for each one individually. The DC for each is 10 plus the arcanum spent on the disease or curse. If you hit, that disease or curse is cured.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the power of this spell.
name: Cure

description:
You create a magical ward that prevents teleportation and all other forms of magical transport into, out of, or through the warded area. The area can be up to 10,000 square feet and 100 feet tall.

You may also have the ward prevent creatures of a certain type from entering the space. Choose one or more of the following creature types: fey, fiends, celestials, elementals, and undead. Any creatures of the chosen types are prevented from entering the area through any means. Any who try take 5d8 radiant damage. Creatures of the chosen types that are within the space when the spell is cast are instantly moved to the closest unoccupied space outside the area. This space must be on the ground.
name: Seal Passage

description:
You summon a massive vine that attempts to restrain and absorb the energy of a creature. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, they take 10d6 acid damage, lose 2d4 Constitution, become poisoned, and if of size Large or smaller, are restrained.

On following turns, you may use an action to repeat the Constitution damage.

On the creature's turn, it may attempt a Fortitude save against your character DC as an action to be free of the spell.
name: Absorb Nutrients

description: You launch a lance of ice at a creature. Make a spell attack against the target's AC. On a hit, they take 12d8 cold damage and their speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.
name: Frost Lance

description:
You attempt to curse a creature with frostbite. Choose a creature within range to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are cursed with frostbite. Their limbs go blue and become numb. They gain a -4 penalty to attacks and damage. Their movement speed is also reduced to 15 feet per round.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum to increase the duration of this curse. The duration increases by 1 week per additional arcanum spent.
name: Curse of Frostbite

description: You regrow a limb or a body part for a living creature. The creature must have an anatomy that is familiar to you for this spell to work. The missing limb regrows over the duration of the spell's cast.
name: Regrow

description:
You send three small balls of ice to various points within range. Once the ice balls reach their destinations, they burst, and all creatures within a 5-foot radius of the ice ball must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d8 cold damage. Creatures that succeed take no damage.

Creatures can be affected by multiple ice bursts, but get to make a separate save for each.
name: Ice Burst

description:
You whisper an incomprehensible message to a target within range. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, they begin to go mad. They find themselves becoming paranoid and obsessing on the gibberish they heard. They lose the ability to sleep and begin taking levels of exhaustion every day.

Affected creatures may re-attempt the Will save every 24 hours to break the effects of the spell.

You may extend the range of this spell to 1 mile by casting it on a personal object owned by the target.
name: Incite Madness

description:
You summon seven frost faeries that circle around you, giving off a dim, frigid light.

You may use your bonus action to convert a faerie into a bolt of ice and launch it at a creature within 120 feet. Make a spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal 4d8 cold damage and the creature's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

You may, as a reaction to being damaged, convert a faerie into a shield of ice. You take 3d8 less damage from the attack.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the number of faeries summoned. You summon one additional faerie per additional arcanum spent.

Reclaim: At any time before the spell's duration completes, you may use a bonus action to end the spell early and regain 1 arcanum per 2 faeries you have left (rounded down).
name: Frost Faeries

description:
You summon cobwebs laced with necrotic energy. Choose a 30 cubic foot area within range for the cobwebs, at least one of the edges of the cubic area must be solid for the cobwebs to anchor to.

Whenever a creature starts its turn in the area, it must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature is restrained, gains the poisoned condition, and their Constitution is lowered by 2d4. Creatures that succeed the save have their movement speed halved and take half damage to their Constitution.

The cobwebs are magical and cannot be set aflame or moved from their location by normal means.

Reclaim: If a creature dies while entangled in the cobwebs, you may spend a reaction to regain 2 arcanum.
name: Choking Cobwebs

description:
You set a glyph of thunder into a 30 by 30 foot square into the ground. When you do, you may designate creatures which do not trigger the glyph. Whenever any other creature steps onto the glyph, all creatures on the glyph must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 10d8 bludgeoning damage and are launched 100 feet into the air. Creatures that succeed take half damage and are not launched upward.

You may use an action to trigger the glyph manually.

Heighten: You may spend additional arcanum, up to your limit, to increase the height this spell launches creatures. For each additional arcanum spent, the creature is launched an additional 20 feet into the air.

Reclaim: If the glyph only affects one creature, you may use a reaction to regain 3 arcanum.
name: Glyph of Thunder

description:
You attempt to revive a creature that has died. The creature must not have been dead longer than a month. You do not need the creature to have all its vital organs for this spell to succeed. But, you must have a majority of the creature's corpse.

The creature returns to life with 1 hit point, 0 death saves, and 2 levels of exhaustion.
name: Resurrect

description: You attempt to create a link with a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, the creature takes all damage you receive over the duration of the spell as void damage.
name: Void Link

description:
You target a creature, making their body boil. The creature must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage, or half as much on a success.

While this spell is active, you may use an action on following turns to continue the effect. Whenever you do, the creature can reattempt the saving throw for half damage. You must have line of sight on the creature to trigger it.
name: Boil Blood

description:
Choose a spell that costs 5 or less arcanum and takes an action to cast. At the beginning of your next turn, the spell will automatically be cast. You may chose the target(s) at the time it is cast and will pay the arcanum cost then.

The spell does not count towards the number of spells you can cast in a turn.
name: Break Arcanum

description:
You create a soul vessel, an object designed to capture and safely store a soul. When you cast this spell, you must have 1 cubic inch of the flesh of the creature you wish to attune to the soul vessel. Otherwise, the container created is worthless.

After the soul vessel is created, if the attuned creature dies while on the same plane as the vessel, their soul is automatically captured by the soul vessel. If the creature is unwilling, the vessel has no effect.

Bodies of creatures whose souls are inside soul vessels cannot be resurrected.

After a soul vessel contains a soul, it will slowly begin to grow. Over the course of 100 days, the soul vessel will have been replaced by the fully matured creature. The new creature has the same memories and abilities of the original but lacks all equipment.
name: Soul Vessel

description:
You gain full control of the weather within a 10-mile radius of you. While you are outdoors and in clear view of the sky, you may channel for 1 minute to change the weather. You gain control of the temperature, wind strength and direction, precipitation, and humidity. It takes up to 10 minutes for the weather change to come into effect, depending on how different it is from the current weather.

During the spell's duration, you may re-channel for 1 minute to change the weather as many times as you like.
name: Control Weather

description: You attempt to copy a creature's fighting style. The target creature must make a Will save against your character DC. On a failure, you replace your to hit and damage bonuses with theirs for the duration of the spell.
name: Copy Talent

description:
You heal a creature within range for 10d6 hit points.

This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
name: Greater Heal

description: You pull down a concentrated beam of sunlight into a 5-foot square within range. Any creature within the affected area must make a Reflex save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 fire damage and 8d10 radiant damage, or half as much on a success.
name: Sunburst

description: You reach out and touch a creature, attempting to connect to them through void energy. On a hit, the creature has a seed implanted in them. As an action on following turns, you may force the creature to make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they take 8d10 void damage. On a success, you take 8d10 void damage.
name: Void Connection

description:
You grant a willing creature the ability to stand up once they've fallen. Whenever the creature reaches 0 hit points, the spell triggers, healing them for 20d6 hit points and removing any status effects on them.

This spell has no affect on undead or constructs.

Reclaim: If the spell does not trigger, you may use your reaction to regain 3 arcanum.
name: Second Chance

description:
You gather all of the natural energy around you and grant them to a willing creature within range. The creature's ability scores all increase by 5, their movement speed is doubled, and they may take two actions on their turn.

At the end of each of the willing creature's turns, they must make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they lose the effects from the spell, take 10d6 acid damage, and gain 2 levels of exhaustion as they are overwhelmed by the magic.

If cast on yourself, you automatically succeed the Will saves.

Reclaim: If the spell ends early due to the creature being overwhelmed, you may use a reaction to regain 3 arcanum.
name: Conduit of Nature

description:
You cause the flora in the 1 square mile region around you to rapidly grow and overtake everything else. For 1 year after the creation of this area, the earth is lush and all of your allies are cured of all status conditions. If they were dying, they stablize and become unconscious instead.

Hostile creatures are automatically poisoned when entering the affected area and take two failed death saves on their turns when they do not roll.

In additional, all beasts that enter the region consider themselves friendly to you and your allies.
name: Create Paradise

description:
You attempt to steal a creature's life essence. Make a spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, you deal 8d8 necrotic damage to them. If this damage is enough to set them to 0 hit points, they automatically fail three death saves.

If this spell kills the target, you gain health equal to the target's maximum hit points. Any excess health gets turned into temporary hit points.
name: Steal Life

description: You surround yourself in a veil of wind and magic. For the duration of the spell, whenever you are about to take damage, you may use a reaction to turn into wind, reducing the damage taken to 0. You become untargetable but lose the ability to take any actions apart from movement. You may use your action to return to your corporeal form on following turns.
name: Atmospheric Veil

description: You conjure 6 meteors that bombard areas within range. Each meteor hits a 15-foot square and none of the meteors may overlap. Creatures in the meteors' paths must make Reflex saves against your character DC. On a failure, they take 12d10 fire damage and 12d10 bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success. Creatures which fail are also knocked prone.
name: Meteor Swarm

description:
You summon a singularity in a square you can see within range. All creatures within 100 feet of the black hole must immediately make a Fortitude save against your character DC. On a failure, they are pulled 60 feet towards the center of the singularity, or half as close on a failed save, or half as far on a successful save. Creatures must reattempt the save at the beginning of their turn with the same effect.

Multiple creatures can occupy the same square when within the same space as the singularity. Creatures which are in the same space as the singularity take 10d10 void damage at the start of their turn. If a creature fails the fortitude save while in the singularity, their movement speed is 0 until the start of their next turn.

Inanimate material is automatically pulled into the singularity, at a speed of 120 feet per round.

When the spell ends, all creatures within the singularity take an additional 10d10 void damage before being ejected into the nearest unoccupied space.

You are not immune to the affects of this spell.
name: Black Hole

description:
You return a creature to life using nothing but a piece of their body. For this spell to succeed, the creature being resurrected must be willing and their soul must not be trapped.

At the completion of this spell's cast, the resurrected creature returns to life at full hit points, 0 death saves, and no exhaustion.
name: True Resurrection

description:
You summon a wisp that floats around you, on guard. As a reaction to a spell being cast on you or you being included in a spell's effect, you may command the wisp to devour the spell. The entire spell vanishes as if it had been counterspelled and you regain arcanum equal to the spell or magical effect's arcanum cost (up to 8).

You may only have one wisp active at a time. If you attempt to summon another wisp, the first one disappears.
name: Devouring Wisp

description: You conjure any inanimate non-magical object you can imagine, provided it can fit within a 100-foot cubic space and is valued at less than 10,000g.
name: Creation

description:
You cover a creature in frozen armor. Their AC cannot be lower than 16 and whenever they take damage, it is reduced to 1.

If a weapon attack against the armor critically strikes, the armor shatters, dealing 6d8 damage to the attacker if they are within melee range.

Reclaim: If the armor is destroyed before the spell's duration completes, you may use a reaction to regain 3 arcanum.
name: Frozen Guardian

description:
You combine ten undead under your control into a huge undead monstrosity. The amalgam is a size Huge undead which acts as any other summons, taking it's turn directly after you in combat.

You may use your bonus action to give the monstrosity commands as long as it is within 60 feet of you. If given no commands, the monstrosity will attempt to fulfill the last command you gave it or, if no commands are relevant, will defend itself.

When the spell's duration ends, or the monstrosity reaches 0 hit points, it dissolves into a pile of decaying sinew and bones.
name: Create Undead Monstrosity

description: You create an illusion, or series of illusions, no more than 50 cubic feet in size. When casting this spell, you can program the illusions to act and sound differently based on triggers and conditions you set. Unlike other illusions, the ones created from this spell are corporeal. Creatures can only successfully detect these are illusions by succeeding on three Insight checks against your character DC. On even one failure, the creature is convinced everything they see is real.
name: Perfect Illusion
